titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Internationalist Books and Community Center Records, 1960-2011 RL.10170
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-29 18:40:14 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Internationalist Books and Community Center records
did.abstract: The Internationalist Books and Community Center Records include materials documenting the organization and operation of the organization, particularly through its Board of Directors; lists of members and volunteers who staffed or supported the bookstore; advertisements and flyers, often handmade, created by store staff for events, sales, and other activities; Internationalist newsletters and drafts; zines and other printed materials collected and distributed by the bookstore; clippings and media coverage about Bob Sheldon and the organization; and other miscellaneous materials. Many of the materials documenting the activities of the Board of Directors were created and collected by Kelly Wooten, a Board member in the early 2000s.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Internationalist Books and Community Center was founded by Bob Sheldon in 1981. Sheldon was a former UNC nurse who moved to Chapel Hill from Colorado in the 1970s. He was a community activist who vocally opposed the Gulf War. Sheldon was murdered in the store in 1991; the case remains unsolved, but many believe it was politically motivated.

Internationalist Books serves as a community space for discussion and dissemination of information about revolutionary and activist movements around the world, as well as alternative politics, economics, history, and lifestyles. The store began as a reading room on Henderson Street, in Chapel Hill, and later operated as an independent bookstore and community gathering place on Rosemary Street and Franklin Street in Chapel Hill. In 2000, Internationlist Books and Community Center achieved non-profit status, and began offering memberships. In 2014, the organization moved again to Lloyd Street in Carrboro.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The Rubenstein Library also holds the Bob Sheldon Papers, documenting his life and writings.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Internationalist Books and Community Center Records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in May 2014.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is restricted. 2 files of member and volunteer lists are closed to researchers for 25 years (until 2039) except by permission of the current manager of the Internationalist Bookstore.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2014-0121

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Internationalist Books and Community Center Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Internationalist Books and Community Center Records include materials documenting the organization and operation of the organization, particularly through its Board of Directors; lists of members and volunteers who staffed or supported the bookstore; advertisements and flyers, often handmade, created by store staff for events, sales, and other activities; Internationalist newsletters and drafts; zines and other printed materials collected and distributed by the bookstore; clippings and media coverage about Bob Sheldon and the organization; and other miscellaneous materials. Many of the materials documenting the activities of the Board of Directors were created and collected by Kelly Wooten, a Board member in the early 2000s.

did.unittitle: Internationalist Books and Community Center records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Zines, printed materials, and other bound volumes collected and distributed by the Internationalist Bookstore. The Zine Library at the Internationalist Bookstore included zines, serials, and monographs. These materials arrived at Rubenstein in binders, arranged alphabetically by title. That arrangement has been maintained in the archival collection. Topics covered by the Zine Library include anarchy, revolutionaries, communism, sexuality and gender, women's rights, poverty, race relations, African American history, and civil rights.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An incomplete run of The Realist magazine, published by the Realist Association. Issues included are 20, 27, 29, 32, 47, 48, 50, 55, 58, 61-67A, 70-72, 74-86B.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings about Bob Sheldon's death and the events and activities of the Internationalist Bookstore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and clippings about Bob Sheldon and the Internationalist Bookstore.

did.unittitle: Flyers and Advertisements Binder: General Advertisements
Flyers and Advertisements Binder: Volunteer Advertisements
Flyers and Advertisements Binder: Event Advertisements
Oversize Flyers and Advertisements: Event Advertisements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article excerpts and drafts for the Internationalist newsletter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Incomplete set of published Internationalist newsletters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Internationalist Books and Community Center by-laws and a draft of personnel guidelines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Meeting agendas, minutes, notes, and correspondence between Board members including documentation on Internationalist Bookstore finances, cash flow, management, and other topics. Notes kept by Kelly Wooten, Board of Directors co-chair and member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files kept by Kelly Wooten when planning and attending Board of Directors retreats in 2002, 2003, and 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notes, research, and drafts from the Internationalist Books strategic planning sessions, held in 2002 and again in 2004-2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes both drafts and examples of fundraising letters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets used by the bookstore with lists of notable children's or young adult books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nominations and awards committee work for the Bob Sheldon Award in 2004 and 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Event recaps kept by a store employee discussing attendance and participation at various events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts from the creation of the membership database.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes advertisements, correspondence, agendas, and meeting minutes from the Internationalist's annual member meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Completed surveys and compiled survey results from Internationalist volunteers discussing their experiences in working at the bookstore.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A set of Polaroid photographs of bookstore volunteers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes advertisements, correspondence, agendas, and meeting minutes from the Internationalist's recruitment, training, and use of community volunteers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This folder is closed to researchers for 25 years (until 2039), except with permission of the current Internationalist Books manager.
